ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to design, implement, and write about an empirical study.
Incredible research, data analysis, and writing skills.

I learned so much about how the erase arch process worked from start to finish. I learned statistics and how to do a great literature review. I feel passionately about the material I covered and like I have a mastery over it.
Familiarizing myself with previous literature and drafting an introduction and methods section of a scientific paper
Wet lab skills and specific lab skills related to neuroscience research in mice like immunostaining, perfusion, cryostating
I learned about academic writing in psychology, and I learned a lot about my thesis topic.

I learned how to think critically about experimental design; how to build a robust literature review in my topic of interest; how to analyze a complex data set using statistical analysis software; and how to write a long form research article.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strength was the team I got to work with that really cared and wanted to help me. 

The weakness was that I couldnt go in in person but this was only due to the pandemic.
Everyone's interaction with their adviser is different. Maybe it would be helpful to encourage advisers to be proactive with their students.

This course really helped me to work and think more independently. I appreciated the opportunity to design and carry out my own empirical analysis, and I know that I will definitely be using this skills in my job next year and in graduate school.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Weekly meetings with my advisor greatly helped for keeping me on track and ensuring that I was completing the work.
It was helpful to be able to physically go into lab
Meeting with my advisor each week really helped me to stay on top of my project and meet deadlines.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, if you need to conduct an empirical study for your degree. It's a great way to get experience in conducting research if that is something you would like to do in the future.
Yes!
Yes

I would definitely recommend this course to another student! The process of working on and completing my senior project has brought me such a new sense of fulfillment and confidence and I know I will carry all the skills with me into my next career steps.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: One-on-one virtual meetings with advisor
Met with advisor virtually on a weekly basis, and other than that worked independently.
Independent study
In-person lab + zoom meetings
This course was for writing my senior thesis. My instructor helped me develop a topic and guided me to useful resources through Zoom meetings.
combination of virtual discussion format and virtual lab
